trans-unit.source: Enables or disables privileges in the specified access token

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables privileges in the specified access token

target.mrk: Enables or disables privileges in the specified access token

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the access token that contains the privileges to be modified.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the access token that contains the privileges to be modified.

target.mrk: Handle to the access token that contains the privileges to be modified.

trans-unit.source: The handle must have $TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES and $TOKEN_QUERY accesses to the token.

seg-source.mrk: The handle must have $TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES and $TOKEN_QUERY accesses to the token.

target.mrk: The handle must have $TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES and $TOKEN_QUERY accesses to the token.

trans-unit.source: The variable that specifies a privileges.

seg-source.mrk: The variable that specifies a privileges.

target.mrk: The variable that specifies a privileges.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is (-1), the function disables of the token's privileges and ignores the $iAttributes parameter.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is (-1), the function disables of the token's privileges and ignores the $iAttributes parameter.

target.mrk: If this parameter is (-1), the function disables of the token's privileges and ignores the $iAttributes parameter.

trans-unit.source: $aPrivileges can be one of the following types.

seg-source.mrk: $aPrivileges can be one of the following types.

target.mrk: $aPrivileges can be one of the following types.

seg-source.mrk: The privilege constant ($SE_*).

target.mrk: The privilege constant ($SE_*).

seg-source.mrk: 1D array of $SE_* constants.

target.mrk: 1D array of $SE_* constants.

trans-unit.source: 2D array of $SE_* constants and their attributes (see below).

seg-source.mrk: 2D array of $SE_* constants and their attributes (see below).

target.mrk: 2D array of $SE_* constants and their attributes (see below).

seg-source.mrk: [0][0] - Privilege

target.mrk: [0][0] - Privilege

seg-source.mrk: [0][1] - Attributes

target.mrk: [0][1] - Attributes

seg-source.mrk: [n][0] - Privilege

target.mrk: [n][0] - Privilege

seg-source.mrk: [n][1] - Attributes

target.mrk: [n][1] - Attributes

trans-unit.source: The privilege attributes. If $aPrivileges parameter is 1D array, $iAttributes applied to the entire array.

seg-source.mrk: The privilege attributes.
If $aPrivileges parameter is 1D array, $iAttributes applied to the entire array.

target.mrk: The privilege attributes.
If $aPrivileges parameter is 1D array, $iAttributes applied to the entire array.

trans-unit.source: If $aPrivileges parameter is (-1) or 2D array, the function ignores this parameter and will use the attributes that specified in this array.

seg-source.mrk: If $aPrivileges parameter is (-1) or 2D array, the function ignores this parameter and will use the attributes that specified in this array.

target.mrk: If $aPrivileges parameter is (-1) or 2D array, the function ignores this parameter and will use the attributes that specified in this array.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be 0 (disables privilege) or any combination of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be 0 (disables privilege) or any combination of the following values:

target.mrk: This parameter can be 0 (disables privilege) or any combination of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED

target.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED

seg-source.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED_BY_DEFAULT

target.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_ENABLED_BY_DEFAULT

seg-source.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_REMOVED

target.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_REMOVED

seg-source.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_USED_FOR_ACCESS

target.mrk: $SE_PRIVILEGE_USED_FOR_ACCESS

trans-unit.source: 2D array of the previous state of any privileges that the function modifies. That is, if a privilege has been modified by this function, the privilege and its previous state are contained in this array.

seg-source.mrk: 2D array of the previous state of any privileges that the function modifies.
That is, if a privilege has been modified by this function, the privilege and its previous state are contained in this array.

target.mrk: 2D array of the previous state of any privileges that the function modifies.
That is, if a privilege has been modified by this function, the privilege and its previous state are contained in this array.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 1 and sets the @extended flag to the following values.

seg-source.mrk: 1 and sets the @extended flag to the following values.

target.mrk: 1 and sets the @extended flag to the following values.

seg-source.mrk: @extended :

target.mrk: @extended :

trans-unit.source: 0 - The function adjusted all specified privileges.

seg-source.mrk: 0 - The function adjusted all specified privileges.

target.mrk: 0 - The function adjusted all specified privileges.

trans-unit.source: 1 - The token does not have one or more of the privileges specified in the $aPrivileges parameter.

seg-source.mrk: 1 - The token does not have one or more of the privileges specified in the $aPrivileges parameter.

target.mrk: 1 - The token does not have one or more of the privileges specified in the $aPrivileges parameter.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function cannot add new privileges to the access token. It can only enable or disable the token's existing privileges.

seg-source.mrk: This function cannot add new privileges to the access token.
It can only enable or disable the token's existing privileges.

target.mrk: This function cannot add new privileges to the access token.
It can only enable or disable the token's existing privileges.

trans-unit.source: To determine whether the function success and adjusted all of the specified privileges, check the @error and @extended flags both, for example:

seg-source.mrk: To determine whether the function success and adjusted all of the specified privileges, check the @error and @extended flags both, for example:

target.mrk: To determine whether the function success and adjusted all of the specified privileges, check the @error and @extended flags both, for example:

seg-source.mrk: If Not (@error Or @extended) Then

target.mrk: If Not (@error Or @extended) Then

seg-source.mrk: EndIf

target.mrk: EndIf
